newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Boeing trades quietly.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Boeing trades quietly.

text.p: Boeing Co was trading quietly in a listless after-hours session, according to traders.

Boeing was trading at par with its close of 95-1/4 on the New York Stock Exchange. It ended regular hours trading down 6-3/4. Earlier Boeing reported disappointing first quarter earnings and warned that profit margins would be under pressure for the near term.
During the after-hours session, Boeing said the margin pressure was mainly due to its shift to newer aircraft models. It also said production could exceed 40 aircraft a month next year.
Intel Corp was up 1/8 on its Nasdaq close of 146-3/8, while Microsoft Corp was also up 1/8 on a close of 114-7/8.
The New York Stock Exchange said Monday session one had a volume of 88,800 shares against 26,100 on Friday. Session two had 1.96 million shares, compared with 1.9 million on Friday, it added.
